Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the H&C officer err in refusing the applicants' humanitarian and compassionate exemption request?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants were failed refugee claimants who argued their skills and family ties justified remaining in Canada.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of H&C officer's refusal decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The Federal Court upheld the H&C officer's decision as reasonable and within jurisdiction.
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after refugee claim rejection and visa overstay
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Presence or absence of undue hardship upon removal
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer found no undue hardship if applicants left Canada
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Exemptions may be granted under s. 25 based on H&C or public policy grounds
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of demonstrated exceptional circumstances or undue hardship
Crimes.Outcome: H&C application refused; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No finding of undue hardship upon removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants sought to remain in Canada under humanitarian and compassionate grounds after refugee claim rejection
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed submitted evidence and assessed relevance and weight
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural unfairness found in evaluation
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: H&C officer acted within statutory authority
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances justifying exemption from removal
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) H&C Officer

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the H&C officer err in refusing the applicants' humanitarian and compassionate exemption request?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants, failed refugee claimants, requested exemption based on H&C grounds; public policy argument raised for first time in judicial review.
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court found no error in officerâ€™s decision; public policy argument not properly raised below.
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after refugee claim denial and failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Existence of undue hardship and eligibility under public policy
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: New argument (public policy) raised for the first time in judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not an issue in the decision
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate relief under s. 25
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer found no undue hardship; skilled workers not recognized under public policy exception
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Exemptions under s. 25 require H&C grounds or established public policy rationale
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Public policy argument not raised in original application; insufficient basis for skilled worker exemption
Crimes.Outcome: H&C application denied; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No undue hardship found upon departure
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants sought to stay in Canada under humanitarian and compassionate grounds after refugee claims were rejected
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered available evidence; new arguments not considered at appellate stage
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Obligation to comply with removal order under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to raise public policy argument during administrative process
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to continued stay post-removal order
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: H&C officer had proper jurisdiction under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances met H&C threshold; public policy not applicable
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) H&C Officer
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: New argument raised too late in proceedings
